page.title: 03Bovingdon Hall Estate
page.content: John Tabor's estate occupies 2,000 acres, north of{Braintree}and {Bocking. Tabors}have farmed there for 300 years. Other{Tabors}own farms in north Essex. The Estate is one of ten {Demonstration Farms}in the{Country- {side Commission Project}combining commercial farming with conservation. There are 93ha of woodland. The main crops on the 688ha of arable land are wheat, barley and oil seed rape. Peas, beans and sugar beet are also grown. There are about 130 beef cattle. With the help of the goverment{ {Agricultural Development Advisory {Service,}trials are being carried out into the disposal of straw, through cultivation techniques. The main sport is shooting.
